structure.unit: G KENTUCKY OFFICE OF HOMELAND SECURITY

text.section: The Kentucky Intelligence Fusion Center is created within the Kentucky Office of Homeland Security to improve intelligence sharing among public safety and public service agencies at the federal, state, and local levels, as well as the private sector.

The Kentucky Intelligence Fusion Center shall be a collaboration between the Kentucky Office of Homeland Security and federal, state, and local agencies, as well as the private sector, including but not limited to those with the primary purpose of law enforcement, public safety, public protection, infrastructure protection, public transit, and corrections.

law.history: Created 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 32, sec. 1, effective June 25, 2013.
